message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken

<<<code>>>: 
```java
String i = "154.232";
StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(i, ".");
String firstPart = st.nextToken();
```

<<<explanation>>>: The StringTokenizer class in Java is used to break a string into tokens. In the provided code, we are creating an instance of StringTokenizer and passing the string and the delimiter (in this case, the decimal point) to the constructor. The nextToken() method is then used to get the first token before the decimal point, effectively removing all characters/numbers after the decimal point.
